example.title: A Simple Extension

chapter.para: Save this file as TestExtension.py in the ~/.local/share/nemo-python/extensions folder. You may need to create this folder. To run, simply restart Nemo.
Once Nemo restarts, right-click on a file and you should see a new menu item, "Showing #filename#". It is as simple as that!

As mentioned above, in order to get loaded by Nemo, a python extension must import the Nemo module from gi.repository, create a class derived from a nemo *Provider and a gobject.GObject, and create the methods that will be called by Nemo when it requests information from its providers. In this case, when someone right-clicks on a file, Nemo will ask all of its MenuProviders for additional menu items to show the user. When folders or files are clicked, the get_file_items method is called and a list of Nemo.MenuItems is expected.
